summary.description: An nnU-Net based model to segment Lung and Nodules from CT scans

inputs.label: Input Image
inputs.description: The CT scan of a patient.

outputs.label: Segmentation
outputs.description: Lung and Nodules (3mm-30mm) from CT scans

details.name: AIMI CT Lung and Nodule
details.type: nnU-Net (U-Net structure, optimized by data-driven heuristics)
details.cite: Murugesan, Gowtham Krishnan, Diana McCrumb, Mariam Aboian, Tej Verma, Rahul Soni, Fatima Memon, and Jeff Van Oss. The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations for Imaging Data Commons Collections. arXiv preprint arXiv:2310.14897 (2023).

publications.title: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations in IDC Collections

use.title: Intended Use
use.text: This model is intended to perform lung and nodules segmentation in CT scans. The model has been trained and tested on scans acquired during clinical care of patients, so it might not be suited for a healthy population. The generalization capabilities of the model on a range of ages, genders, and ethnicities are unknown.

analyses.title: Quantitative Analyses
analyses.text: The model's performance was assessed using the Dice Coefficient and 95% Hausdorff (mm).

references.label: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations for Imaging Data Commons Collections

evaluation.title: Evaluation Data
evaluation.text: A validation set of 47 cases were reviewed by two radiologists

references.label: Image segmentations produced by the AIMI Annotations initiative

training.title: Training Data
training.text: The DICOM-LIDC-IDRI-Nodules dataset was used to train an AI model to annotate lung nodules. This dataset included 883 studies with annotated nodules from 875 patients. Within the dataset only nodules that were identified by all four of their radiologists (size condition: 3mm ≤ diameter ≤ 30mm), were considered for AI model training for this task. The lung annotations AI model was trained on 411 and 111 lung CT data from NSCLC Radiomics and NSCLC Radiogenomics respectively.
